The backbone of a Space Marine chapter, Tactical Marines excel at a wide variety of battlefield roles. Armed with a bolter or other rifle-sized weapon, the Tactical Marine can hunt down the enemy, take and hold territory and hold ground with equal skill.

Equipped with jump packs and armed with fearsome close-combat weapons, Assault Marines scream across the battlefield like avenging angels. Assault Marines excel at quick strikes deep into enemy territory. In close-combat, they are without peer, but they have little ranged firepower.

Ranged Weapons: Choice of Pistol (can be upgraded to Bolter with Perk)
Close Combat: Sword, Axe or Hammer

Devastators are the most heavily armed of all Space Marines, trained to assail the enemy from great distance and with overwhelming firepower. Their supremacy at ranged combat does come at the cost of mobility and close-combat prowess, however.

Close Combat: Combat knife only

Chaos Raptors are the assault specialists of the Chaos Legions. They consider themselves an elite within their Legions and warbands, wearing distinctive jump packs and taking to the air like merciless birds of prey. They excel at hit and run tactics and are without compare in close combat.

Ranged Weapons: Choice of Pistol (can be upgraded to Bolter with Perk)
Close Combat: Sword, Axe or Hammer

Ranged Weapons: Choice of Heavy Weapon
Close Combat: No weapon, simple kick or clearing stomp

The Mk XI Hell's Teeth chainsword is the close-combat weapon of choice among Space Marines, combining terrifying power and great speed. Its silhouette is a symbol of the Imperium's greatest warriors.
Consecrated to the dark powers of Chaos, this chainsword hums with the bloodlust of its dark masters. These dark rites have not reduced the weapon's speed or precision on the battlefield.
This perfectly balanced Power Axe is sheathed in a sparking power field and delivers devastating blows able to crack open heavy armor.
Favored by the dread warriors of Khorne, the hideous Chain Axe is slower to use than the chainsword, but delivers tremendous damage.

The mighty Thunder Hammer is the rarest of Space Marine melee weapons. Each blow discharge a powerful blast from the hammer's dedicated power field. A powerful overhead swing creates a massive detonation, damaging all nearby enemies.

A powerful daemon of hatred is bound within this huge maul, giving each blow terrible destructive power. Swinging the Daemon Maul overhead into a smash causes a detonation of foul energies that damage anyone nearby.
The Astartes Mk III Bolt Pistol is a compact, slower-firing version of the Space Marine Boltgun. Designed as a backup weapon, it nonetheless provides ample stopping power.
In service for millennia, this pistol pulses with the hatred of the Chaos Space Marines who have wielded it. With every bolt fired, it barks out another call for slaughter.

The MK III Sunfury Plasma Pistol fires balls of super-heated plasma, making it a deadly companion to a close-combat weapon. The pistol can also fire a supercharged blast, although doing so is quick to overheat the weapon.

Chaos-tainted plasma pistols fire balls of super-heated plasma, making it a deadly companion to a close-combat weapon. The pistol can also fire a supercharged blast, although doing so is quick to overheat the weapon.

The standard-issue Godwyn pattern Bolter is the most characteristic weapon in the Space Marine arsenal. Firing self propelled explosive tipped rounds, each bolter is hand crafted and blessed by the chapter's Techmarines.

Bearings the sigils and marks of the dread Chaos Legions, this bolter is the fearsome counterpart to the gleaming weapons of the Loyalist chapters. Each self-propelled explosive round is branded with these same dark sigils.

The Storm Bolter is a double-barreled boltgun with a rate of fire just shy of that of the much bulkier Heavy Bolter. This hail of projectiles comes at the expense of stability, limiting the weapon's effectiveness at medium or long range.
The product of the desecrated forges of the Iron Warriors Legion, the Twin-linked Bolter used by some Chaos Space Marines is designed to chew through any Loyalist who dares close range.

Famously wielded by Ultramarines Scout Sergeant Telion, the Stalker Bolter is the hallmark of a Space Marine favoring precision over brute force. Depending on the specific modifications made by the wielder, the Stalker Bolter can serve as a precision battle rifle or a high-powered sniper weapon.
The Daemon Eye Bolters used by some Chaos Space Marines have foul Warp creatures bound into them. These daemonic fiends warp space along the projectile's path, creating a weapon of deadly precision.

A product of the Adeptus Mechanicus experimental weapons program, the Graia-pattern Vengeance Launcher is not authorized for use off world. Those Space Marines who have field tested the weapon, however, attest to its effectiveness against a range of targets.
Stolen from Forge World Graia and desecrated in the smithies of the Iron Warriors Traitor Legion, this Tainted Vengeance Launcher honors the Dark Gods of Chaos with each victim it obliterates.

The MK XII Ragefire-type Plasma Gun fires charged energy pulses able to damage heavily armored targets. This weapon is deadly, but prone to overheating. Wielders must manage heat carefully lest their weapon shutdown in the heat of battle.

Adorned with the sigils of Chaos, this desecrated Plasma Gun fires charged energy pulses able to damage heavily armored targets. This rapid-fire weapon is deadly, but prone to overheating. Wielders must manage heat carefully lest their weapon shutdown in the heat of battle.
The Vulkan Assault Pattern Melta Gun fires a scorching plume of molecularly agitated heat at close range. This power comes at the expense of low ammunition stores and a long recharge between shots.

Sorcerous incantations have bound this Melta Gun to the forces of Chaos. It fires a scorching plume of molecularly agitated heat at close range. This power comes at the expense of low ammunition stores and a long recharge between shots.

The Astartes Mk IVa Heavy Bolter replicates the staggering firepower of emplaced weapons in a form portable by a mighty Space Marine. By planting his feet, the wielder can gain increased rate of fire and accuracy at the cost of mobility.

Adorned in honor of the Chaos Gods, this Tainted Heavy Bolter replicates the staggering firepower of emplaced weapons in a form portable by a mighty Chaos Space Marine. By planting his feet, the wielder can gain increased rate of fire and accuracy at the cost of mobility.
The MK XIII Plasma Cannon unleashes a succession of explosive charged blasts, able to penetrate enemy armor and obstacles. The user can also unleash a devastating charged shot.

Daemons of warpfire are bound in the firing chamber of the Tainted Plasma Cannon. It unleashes a succession of explosive charged blasts, able to penetrate enemy armor and obstacles. The user can also unleash a devastating charged shot.
The Astartes MK VII Lascannon fires a charged energy blast along a powerful laser and can cut through almost any armor at extreme range. Features a powerful optical scope with variable magnification.

Marked with dark sigils of precision and destruction, the Tainted Lascannon fires a charged energy blast along a powerful laser and can cut through almost any armor at extreme range. Features a powerful optical scope with variable magnification.

The most ubiquitous Space Marine power armor, the Aquila-pattern features its titular double-headed eagle emblazoned across the chest plate. For the vast majority of humanity, the Mk7 is the only image they have of Space Marines -- epic heroes bearing gleaming armor and fearsome death's heads.

An update and modification to the Mk7 'Aquila', the Errant-pattern armor features reinforced joints, covered cabling, and a new armored collar. Not yet in wide use, the small number of Errant armors released to the chapters are usually entrusted to members of the honor guard or other leaders.

Most Space Marines keep their armor in gleaming condition, taking time to practice maintenance rites in the field and relying on the artificers of the chapter keeps. Some veterans, however, just as lovingly preserve some evidence of damage -- each scar acting as a memento of a past victory.

Space Marine veterans collect a large number of special medals and commendations, making their armor into a record of their service. From laurels and tabards commonly awarded, to more individual awards, each veteran's deeds adorn his power armor.

In the 41st Millennium, the chapter artificers spend their time rediscovering techniques lost to the past. This suit of power armor is a concrete product of such lost techniques, performing better than contemporary models in almost all ways.

Reverence of the past does not prevent the most skilled of artificers from producing true masterpieces. This lovingly customized power armor combines recovered artifacts of the past and new approaches in equal measure.

Issued during the time of the Great Crusade, Maximus-pattern armor was still being deployed to Space Marines when Horus led half the legions into heresy and revolt. This fearsome armor is now a reminder of those dark days, and of the triumph of the loyalist forces.

Issued in the millennia after the Horus Heresy, while work was still underway on the Mk7 Aquila pattern, the Corvus power armor was once ubiquitous among Space Marine chapters. Its most distinctive feature was a pointed helmet design, which was abandoned for the straight look of the Aquila-pattern.
There is no standard armor among the Legions of Chaos. Each Chaos Space Marine adorns himself in the best power armor he can, often pillaging new parts from any loyalist he kills.

In the twisted mindset of the Chaos Space Marine, only strength and power have any real value. This foul armor is an expression of the Traitor Marine's utter disdain for anything and anyone weaker than himself.
A foul expression of the hatred the Traitor Legions turn against the Emperor and Terra, this unholy armor seems to gain in power with every Loyalist its wearer kills.

Chaos Space Marines who give in completely to their rage and fury gain the favor of the Blood God Khorne. They enter battle with cries of fury and descend on their foes with unparalleled savagery. Once battle has started, even their allies are fair prey for these killers.

Look for ways to flank your enemies rather than face them head-on.
Use your environment to your advantage. Enemies with Jump Packs have a tough time with low ceilings or overhangs.
Don't get tunnel vision, always be looking around for enemies that are above or below you.
Use Braced Fire on the Heavy Bolter to hold a position, but switch up locations to avoid getting flanked.
Use Frag Grenades to force enemies out of position. Follow up with another if you think you know where they will move to.
Don't get discouraged. If one loadout isn't working, try something else or use a different tactic.
Uncap enemy points whenever possible, even if you don't intend to capture it fully.
When using the Jump Pack, time your jumps wisely or you may find yourself out of power at a crucial moment.
Be unpredictable: The Jump Pack is a great tool to fake movement one way and then appear from another location.
Be aggressive: Sometimes rushing an enemy who thinks you're reloading can catch them off guard.
Be a master of all classes in order to handle all kinds of gameplay scenarios.
If one capture point is heavily contested, try attempting to steal a less active one to move the action.
Re-entering combat on captured points takes longer, but it gets you back into the fight more quickly.
When waiting to re-enter combat, look for teammates who have the Teleport Homer perk equipped. You can come in on their location.
The Tactical Marine's Melta Gun is the natural rival of Assault Marines/Raptors.
One headshot with the Bolt Pistol will kill anyone with no Armor.

The Plasma Gun charged shot will completely strip anyone's Armor... Unless they are a Devastator/Havoc with an Iron Halo/Chaos Icon.
With most weapons you can continue to reload even while rolling or evading.
You can continue to reload while sprinting.
The Storm Bolter/Twin Bolter has a great rate of fire, but its scatter makes it less effective at long ranges.
The Stalker/Daemon Eye Bolter is far less accurate when fired from the hip.
The experimental Graia-pattern Vengeance Launcher has charges that can be detonated in mid-air. Use it creatively.
A Devastator/Havoc Marine cannot be killed by a unmodified single grenade.
The Heavy Bolter is the only ballistics weapon that can overheat.
The Plasma Cannon can easily kill its owner. Fire with care.
One headshot with the Lascannon will kill anyone... Unless they are a Devastator/Havoc with an Iron Halo/Chaos Icon.
The Serrated Combat Blade perk gives the Tactical Marines a legitimate melee kill option.
Tactical Marines can use the Tactical Readout perk to prey on the weak.
The Devastator/Havoc perks are primarily defensive in nature. Play accordingly.
Certain perks pair together naturally, creating a specific, effective play style.
The Devastator/Havoc can perform a brutal chest kick on an enemy, stopping incoming attacks and creating space.
Assault Marines/Raptors can sow confusion from the air with blind grenades.
If timed correctly, you can fire two Plasma Gun charged shots without overheating.
The Lascannon can shoot through some objects.
A Bolter with both weapon perks is one of the most effective weapons in the game.
Keep an eye out for the telltale shatter of an enemy's Armor. That's the time to press the advantage.
After death, you can grab your killer's loadout for one life by selecting the Copy Loadout ability before re-entering combat.
If a capture point you own is blinking, that means an enemy is uncapping it.
If you know an enemy Assault Marine/Raptor is targeting you from above, drop a grenade at your feet and evade away.
The Devastator's stomp is an effective weapon against Assault Marines/Raptors.
Grenades don't have to kill. Use them to strip armour and then close in.
The Plasma Cannon's shots do much more damage with direct hits rather than splash damage at the feet.
Vengeance Launcher charges do not always have be detonated. They work great as visual deterrents.

If I could summon it again -- contain it, control it -- then perhaps I could use it to defend the Imperium.
So, I made another interstellar journey through the Warp.
Barely daring to hope, I lowered my psychic defenses and willed the energy to return.
I captured the spark in a containment device, and marvelled at its potential.
With my psychic abilities, I had drawn energy from the Warp.
I found a planet where I could work, unobserved: a remote Forge World.
The Adeptus Mechanicus gave me free reign when I told them I was developing a weapon with a new, 'unorthodox' energy source.
They know the Xenos will soon choke humanity out of the galaxy.
If my weapon will help keep our species alive, they will not ask questions.
Experimentation with the Warp energy is proceeding rapidly.
I no longer need to travel into the Warp to pull more energy into this dimension.
I was naive to think that my incursion into Warp space had gone unnoticed.
Someone -- some thing -- has taken an interest.
When I manipulate the energies, I feel a presence pushing against my psychic defenses, testing me.
I needed to test the Warp device's capabilities.
Running the Titan Manufactorum with it -- or rather, with the 'power source' -- provided a convenient opportunity.
The techpriests are practically giddy with its success.
But this is a trivial accomplishment.
I am impatient to begin testing the Warp device's psychic attributes.
I am just waiting for the live cargo to arrive.
The stench of aliens permeates this facility -- but it is tolerable, because it represents progress.
I acquired specimens for experimentation: Ork, Tau, Eldar.
Even a Tyranid lictor, which nearly caused a revolt among my techpriest allies.
I designed the weapon to use the Warp energies to target the weak points in the Xenos brain, and rupture them.
When I put it into practice, however, the specimen's head explodes.
The Warp energies affect different species in different ways.
Essentially, I can tune this weapon to cause maximum damage to whatever enemy we face.
If humans are caught in the blast wave, they will not be harmed.
I have not slept in two days.
The more I use the Warp device, the stronger the assault on my psychic shields.
I am hearing things, now -- a name, a constant whisper in my mind.
Because something completely unexpected has happened: Orks are invading this planet.
The Psychic Scourge weapon is nearly ready, and millions of Orks will prove the ultimate test subjects.
History will remember this as the moment we turned the tide against the alien threat to our people....
Caleb, there you are. The Shiring brothers are saying we're under attack!
They saw Roks in the sky.
-- the Orks have reached the Western territories.
Not when all the planetary defenses -- and the Skitarii -- stand between us and them.
First you don't believe there's an invasion, and now you're not worried about it at all.
Lilith, we have a far better chance of being killed on the assembly line than by a far-away Ork.
I didn't know where else to go.
People are saying the Skitarii are dead.
The increase in worker absences has been noted.
Caleb, what are we going to do?
This factory is a far better place than the hab blocks to make a last stand.
If I'm going to die today, I want to face it straight on.
You stubborn fool -- you are not going to die today!
There's got to be a place where we can hide --
The Orks are in the loading bays.
Why are you blocking the door?
This room isn't safe enough -- we have to go, Caleb!
Transmechanic Second Class Petronius, entering duty log 31127.
I detected a signal that should not have been there, but Transmechanic First Class Aleric refused to believe me.
That pulsar I thought was a Tau warship.
Missing the signal from the Fabricator General's transport.
But I am not wrong every time!
There's something approaching from the far side of the sun.
For days, I tracked that signal coming from beyond the sun.
I didn't tell Transmechanic First Class Aleric because I didn't want to be ridiculed.
And today I heard voices -- the signal's an Ork fleet heading straight for Graia!
You should have seen the shock on his face.
If he'd believed me a week ago, we would have had that much more warning.
He was wrong -- I was right.
The Orks have thrown my duties into chaos.
I only get distress calls now.
'The Xenos are here,' 'The hab block's on fire.'
And today, Transmechanic Aleric insisted I contact every single planetary defense outpost.
He just didn't want to do it himself.
None of the stations picked up.
When I told him that, Aleric rushed off.
I suppose even an Ork invasion can't change some people.
The Orks broke into the temple.
I couldn't hear them -- I was plugged into my console.
Then someone crashed into me, hard, from behind -- it was Transmechanic Aleric.
He had an Ork axe in his chest.
He'd blocked the attack meant for me.
The Ork went berserk -- he grabbed for me but only caught my robe.
I don't know if I deserved it.
It's been three days since Aleric died, the Orks have finally left the temple.
The liberation fleet is on route, with Ultramarines leading an advance force.
But they are only now entering the Immaterium.
I hope I am wrong, like I've been so many times before.
But I fear that by the time the Ultramarines come to our rescue, everyone on this planet will be dead.
-- not in the disease ward, Dominus.
Ork projectile to the leg, Magos Cassia.
Very well. I shall prepare for the implant grafting--
Just get rid of her leg and stitch her up fast.
-- has a deep wound to the arm.
We can't stop him from going septic.
Make him comfortable and move on.
You've seen these kinds of wounds before?
Unfortunately, yes -- in my first Ork invasion, which I hoped would be my last.
Yet, here I am again. Right, who's next --
-- we're almost out of sterile dressings.
I haven't even begun to treat the new burn victims yet.
I am a Magos Biologis. No wound or malady is beyond me --
You are in a triage situation.
Observe, analyze and decide who we can save.
-- there's no room for them in the south ward.
Put them on the second level --
That's where I've been moving the dying.
We must focus on the wounded already under our care. This is the only way.
Take the servitors to keep the crowds back --
-- radio says the Orks are two streets away.
What are you injecting him with -- stop!
I have enough for every patient.
In ten minutes, the Orks will break through those doors and slaughter them all in their beds.
Better to die in peace before that.
It's the last thing I can do for them --
Hannah hasn't returned -- I think they're going to close off that whole stratum.
You'll be back from the food depot before we are.
Tell your mother where I am when she arrives -- and both of you, stay there.
Pack up the food as best you can.
Reports are that the Orks have already reached the Manufactorum.
We'll need to leave as soon as we're together.
Benjamin, we've waited as long as we can.
The Orks are crossing the mainline bridge.
I have to get Hannah and your mother out of here.
When you get this message, leave immediately -- go to hab block seventy four.
We're going to gather with others from our shift-group.
Come and find us -- stay safe.
Benjamin, I feel like I'm leaving breadcrumbs for you to follow.
We can't wait for you here.
The whole idea was safety in numbers, but they didn't bother to wait.
We're heading for Evacuation Centre Epsilon.
We got caught in an Ork ambush.
They cornered your sister -- she was screaming -- and your mother threw herself at them.
They laughed, Benjamin -- the worst sound I have ever heard -- and I grabbed Hannah.
But your mother -- they took her and they broke her and I couldn't --
We made it to Epsilon Centre.
Benjamin, we have to leave Epsilon Center.
I'm so sorry, Ben -- I can't leave you the next breadcrumb, because I don't have a plan anymore.
We've lost your mother, and I'm so afraid we've lost you, too.
I have to keep Hannah safe.
That means we can't stay in one place long.
But I promise you, Benjamin, I will find you.
These Greenskins believe in armor, it seems.
The Orks have disabled the brakes.
The Orks must be operating that crane.
They will not stop until they break through that gate.
The Orks have managed to power that cannon.
Even a single shot will blast right through the gates.
Number Two Control Deck, do you read?
Did you drop that cargo on the Orks?
There is a service lift in the hangar directly below where you dropped the cargo, my lord.
A handful of Guardsmen holding that huge gate.
They did manage to bring the access bridge down, robbing the Orks of their advantage of numbers.
The Greenskins are on the move again.
If they find the access point we are using, we will not last long.
I'm sending the lift up now.
But if they get past you, they'll find a way down!
I will show you the way inside.
The Xenos haven't left a single structure undamaged.
The techpriests will have to bring all of these structures down, and rebuild.
This time on top of a mass grave.
There. Drogan said to meet at that monument.
Whatever you're doing, Captain, keep at it.
The Greenskins are swarming your way, leaving our path open.
Captain, we are within sight of the Imperial Guard bastion.
We are near the landing zone, but it is still swarming with Orks.
Get me there at maximum speed.
This whole planet has gone mad!
Do not give into fear now.
Your troops need you more than ever.
We will be on the ground shortly--
We must get to that Valkyrie.
She crashed further down the canyon.
I made it out of the crash--
But this canyon is full of heretics.
Find shelter. We are on our way.
He is keeping the portal open!
Captain, duty requires that I put voice to my concerns.
There are the main walls of the lower Hab Blocks.
The water supply pipes form a bridge across the canyon.
A few weeks ago, millions of people lived here.
An Ork invasion, and now the tender mercies of Chaos heretics.
I am surprised the place is standing at all.
The Greenskins have been pressing us hard--
Both down here and at the bastion proper.
But I don't know the status of the other platoons.
The forces of Chaos are driving the Orks before them, so you can expect more attacks.
The other platoons are going to fall back toward the Bastion.
Hold this position, or they'll be cut off.
Get ready to fall back to the bastion.
Do not engage Chaos forces directly until I get reinforcements down here to back you up.
Lieutenant Mira, this is Bastion Primus.
We're under heavy assault -- the Orks are back.
And they cut power to the sentry guns!
We couldn't defend it against such numbers -- we had to fall back.
The Ultramarines and I are almost at your position.
Will we never be free of the damned Orks?
You can see why we need the sentry guns.
There aren't enough of us to hold this position without them.
Lieutenant, the central outpost is under attack!
Tell them we're on our way!
Defend the line -- use the turret!
If you continue on, you'll find it at the end of our fortifications.
I will contact you once I have restored power.
Brothers, the Guardsmen will need your help until the guns are reactivated.
Lieutenant Mira, the generator is at full power.
It's working -- the sentry guns are back online!
Your men should be able to withstand the Ork assault.
Captain, your men are near an access point to the rail network. My Guardsmen will point the way.
Another gateway is close to your position.
The Imperial Guard is once again in your debt, Captain.
The rail network is underground -- through here.
You might not be alone down there.
We were never able to clear the tunnels of Orks.
A few Orks will not be a problem.
We are running into Orks down here.
Just enough to be an annoyance.
Captain Titus, the Orks are running scared.
The Captain dealt with their Warboss once and for all.
This rail line will take us directly to the Titan Manufactorum.
And gave Nemeroth time to prepare his invasion.
We must get to the Titan and destroy that Warp gate.
Though he is trapped on this world.
And all the more desperate to recover the power source.
We must get it to safety, old friend.
You think the device is still of use to Nemeroth, without the Warp gate?
Sidonus, contact our allies and find a way off this planet.
Lieutenant Mira reports that the Liberation Fleet has entered the system.
The Inquisition will surely have sent agents with the fleet, Captain.
Perhaps we can return the device to them--
Contact Lieutenant Mira and have her divert a Valkyrie here to pick us up.
Tell her we will require transport to the fleet once it enters orbit.
I suppose putting a bolter round through that damnable power source is out of the question.
My most trusted brother will bring it to our Strike Cruiser and seal it in the armory.
Lieutenant Mira's Valkyrie is on its way, Captain.
We make for the landing pad, and watch for the Chaos Lord's forces.
The liberation fleet has entered the system.
And even better, our Ultramarines battle brothers are on route.
And this landing pad does not offer much cover.
Captain Titus - we're ready to transport you.
Its ruins hang in the sky against all reason.
Chaos forces are concentrated around the tower.
The fleet is preparing an all out assault.
From the floor - heavy servo turret!
Ultramarines - The logic engine thinks we are escaped Xenos specimens.
There is a control panel in the side room--
Get me there and I can shut it down.
The exit will open shortly, Captain.
However, I'm afraid the servo turrets beyond this room remain primed.
If this is the firing core, Inquisitor, does it discharge through the whole facility?
The core actually raises to the rooftop of the facility.
That is where the rest of the firing array is located.
Now proceed to the main control panel.
You will need to manually restart the array alignment.
Alert - energy levels outside experimental parameters.
Titus, your jump pack's not firing!
I am Nemeroth, your herald and champion!
I have burned a thousand worlds in your dark names!
You challenged me to recover this fragment of your power, and I have done so!
The slaves of the False Emperor who dared claim it as their own lie dead at my hand!
I return your dark relic to you...
I offer up this world and all those upon it...
I ask for the reward that was promised!
He thinks to face me in battle!
Corrupt my flesh, make me daemonkind!
Show this fool the true nature of power!
You are no threat to me now, Ultramarine.
I have the will of the Dark Gods behind me.
And you will die here, alone.
The power of Chaos is within you, calling to this relic.
With it, you shattered this mighty spire -- but so much more awaits.
Imagine the Ultramarines dominating this galaxy in glorious conquest, with you at their head.
Imagine the power you could wield--
The gods of Chaos protect me with the very energies of creation.
